pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 2 by SSCI

content.raw: This submission is similar to the current X2 config 6 with an upward point lidar. Can you explain the perception value added by an upward point lidar on a UGV?
content.html: This submission is similar to the current X2 config 6 with an upward point lidar. Can you explain the perception value added by an upward point lidar on a UGV?

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 2 by SSCI

content.raw:
We decided to add an upward lidar on all ground vehicles that we built in order to scout out for vertical shafts or high ceilings above the ground vehicles.  This is primarily for mapping, and would be the type of information that could be relayed to flying vehicles that could scan those areas later.  We based it off of a lidarlite type of laser since they are inexpensive and easy to integrate on a real vehicle.  However, if this is the deciding point between accepting this model and not accepting it, we would gladly remove it.  

The other difference with this vehicle versus x2 config 6 is the addition of rgbd cameras that can observe the ground in front of the vehicle and the ceiling.  It is important to see the ground in order to sense small obstacles and to see the ceiling in order to see high artifacts and for mapping.  The intention was to build an alternative to config 6 that had just as much perception capability, but with much lower-cost sensors \(since velodyne 3D lidars are quite expensive but 2D lidars like the RPLidar S1 are inexpensive in comparison and lighter-weight\).
content.html:
We decided to add an upward lidar on all ground vehicles that we built in order to scout out for vertical shafts or high ceilings above the ground vehicles. This is primarily for mapping, and would be the type of information that could be relayed to flying vehicles that could scan those areas later. We based it off of a lidarlite type of laser since they are inexpensive and easy to integrate on a real vehicle. However, if this is the deciding point between accepting this model and not accepting it, we would gladly remove it.

The other difference with this vehicle versus x2 config 6 is the addition of rgbd cameras that can observe the ground in front of the vehicle and the ceiling. It is important to see the ground in order to sense small obstacles and to see the ceiling in order to see high artifacts and for mapping. The intention was to build an alternative to config 6 that had just as much perception capability, but with much lower-cost sensors (since velodyne 3D lidars are quite expensive but 2D lidars like the RPLidar S1 are inexpensive in comparison and lighter-weight).

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 2 by SSCI

content.raw: Hmm, I’m realizing most of what I said was valid, but that I was actually describing our x2 config 8 vehicle above.  So, the major difference on this configuration is the use of a 3d lidar with less range that is less expensive than the 300 m lidar.
content.html: Hmm, I’m realizing most of what I said was valid, but that I was actually describing our x2 config 8 vehicle above. So, the major difference on this configuration is the use of a 3d lidar with less range that is less expensive than the 300 m lidar.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 2 by SSCI

content.raw:
This configuration is similar to the existing X2C6 with the addition of an upward point lidar. Your other \(merged\) X2 submission also has the added upward point lidar capability. Due to time constraints, this configuration will not be incorporated before the code freeze.   
  
Would you like to keep this PR open for consideration after Urban Circuit?
content.html:
This configuration is similar to the existing X2C6 with the addition of an upward point lidar. Your other (merged) X2 submission also has the added upward point lidar capability. Due to time constraints, this configuration will not be incorporated before the code freeze.

Would you like to keep this PR open for consideration after Urban Circuit?

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 2 by SSCI

content.raw: This PR can be closed. Thank you.
content.html: This PR can be closed. Thank you.
